body.name: AooDen Portable Countertop Dishwasher, Compact Dishwasher with 6L Built-in Water Tank, No Hookup Needed, 4 Washing Programs
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 10 hrs 14 mins
features: No More Hand Washing: Say goodbye to washing dishes by hand with the AooDen countertop dishwasher, comes with 6L built-in water tank perfect for small kitchens, apartments, and RVs.

4 Wash Programs: This dishwasher offers 4 wash programs, including Normal washing, Speed washing, Enhance washing, Strong Drainage. It can meet all your different cleaning needs with just one machine. And the transparent window allows you to easily view the washing progress.

Compact Design: With a compact size of 18.9 × 15 × 15.75 inches, this dishwasher can fit on most kitchen countertops or in small apartments. It is perfect for small families, couples, or singles who want a convenient and efficient dishwasher.

Easy to Use: This dishwasher is simple to operate with intuitive controls and indicators. It comes with a user manual that makes it easy to set up and start using right away. 【NOTE】You can just add the detergent(Pods, liquids, or powder detergents) on the filter screen.
Quiet Operation: The countertop dishwasher operates at only 52 dbs, so you won't even know it's runningThe transparent window allows you to easily view the washing progress.
body.description: Introducing our portable countertop dishwasher, the perfect solution for small kitchens, apartments, and RVs. This dishwasher is also designed for easy installation and use. Simply connect it to your kitchen faucet with the included adapter, and you're ready to go. The LED display and button controls make it easy to select your wash program and monitor the progress of your wash.Say goodbye to hand-washing dishes and hello to the convenience of our portable countertop dishwasher. Product InformationColor:WhiteProduct Dimension:18.9 × 15 × 15.75 inchesProduct Weight:15 lbsRate voltage:110V ACMaximum power:800W Product Features- Washing quantity:4 sets- Free Installation of water tank- Washing Time:30-50 minutes- Wash method:Shuttle- Drying method:Waste heat drying- Child Protection:Child Lock- Water consumption:6L (Single use:1.5L )- Funnctional procedures: Quick washing, Standrad washing, Enhance washing, Strong drainagePackage Included1 X AooDen T09 Dishwasher1 X User manual1 X Tableware Rack1 X Drain HoseWarranty Service1 month money back warranty in no reason12 months warranty

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: For 1 person and a dog, it's amazing! Does what it is supposed to do! I can't spend 2 hours every week on a day off washing rinsing and drying dishes. I load this up, put in a dishwasher tab, put the cover on and push start. I use the antibacterial 4 wash setting since I wash dog dishes and my coffee cups together.It would be great if there was a fill line on the water tank. It would be great if the directions told you how to get to the quick wash and other settings.Play with it! I've done dishes every night and have been super 😄!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Needs directions but does the job
reviews.reviewText: I like it. Directions don’t work but just fill it up in back, get a drain in and put the soap in the holder I guess and put on number 4 and lock it💭

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars A baby could accidentally wash dishes better than this thing.
reviews.reviewText: 👎There is NO power in the water streams that come out of the spinner. It is SUPER noisy too! The "instructions" are very poorly translated from another language. This makes most of it extremely unclear on what it is trying to say. There are no set up directions included in the "instructions". Overall, I think this is a terrible dishwasher. Don't waste your time buying this...I mean, unless you're trying to just give your already clean dishes a sauna; then this would be perfect. 😅

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: i can see me dishes getting clean, did have to get a clamp for the hose not to come off the bottom of washer. it is big does take up a bit of space. i live in an rv i have it on a folding dinner table with a bucket under table works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Attached is a video of when we first got it. I have a love hate with this dishwasher. We live off septic so do not have a dishwasher, we plan on putting one in eventually but I have never hated doing dishes so much! This dishwasher helps some with that stress. I have 3 kids so if I don’t do dishes immediately after dinner, it’s easy for the dishes to get piled up, which unfortunately happens quite frequently and then I’m at the sink for AT LEAST an hour. This dishwasher is small, maybe holds 4 bowls at a time to give reference. The instructions were useless, gave no indication of anything. Luckily everything was fairly easy to figure out. Except where the soap is suppose to be. We just place it on the rack and I suppose it works pretty well. The lid is finicky…if you have anything that’s too tall, or makes it wobble and not sit perfectly on there, there’s no way make it lock. The “lock” button is just for the button features. Not for the lid. So sometimes I have felt the need to put something heavy on top to weight the lid down. I have found from experience also that I have to check that the back hose is correctly secured EVERY single use because on 2 occasions, it came undone so I had water everywhere (the first time I caught in time). Must need to clean it pretty good on occasion also because for a couple days, the spinning part decided randomly not to work, then started randomly working again but slowly. We cleaning some of the holes out with a toothpick and it seems to be working correctly again….even with all this complaint, I can still give it a 3 star because it’s fast and I can load 4 bowls up, walk away, do something else, and come back shortly to load up a few more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The Good, Bad, and Overall...
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The Good: Great for daily dish washing. I work on a military base in the Middle East and have been carrying my dirty dishes to the shower room for years; not going to wash them in the bathroom. This is a great solution for me as I can wash my dishes in the office during the day. So no more stacks of accumulated dirty dishes.The Bad: This device isn't smart. I have to use a step down transformer and the unit I was using could not support the wattage. I started a load and it tripped. Because I'm a guy and believe it could have been a fluke I reset and tried again. That also tripped. The problem is that the unit has no monitoring of the current water level in the washer. So unit would fill, as soon as cycle began it would trip, reset the power, if filled again, reset the power after changing out the step down transformer, and it filled a third time. So I had a cascading waterfall in my office. Luckily, I had a large towel nearby and contained the spill. To be fair there is a drain option I could have chosen, but I didn't want to waste the soap and water loaded. So don't do what I did and you will be fine. Also, there are 2 thin cracks in the dome cover. Package was very well packed and not pointing fingers here, but it looks like they may have shipped a damaged unit to me.Overall: I have 2 gallon jugs filled with water. One gallon will fill the reservoir and I have a bucket to collect the drainage. Speaking of the drain, the hose is held only by friction. I pushed in onto the drain valve but it may come loose. Best to reinforce it with a small hose clamp. Unit does very well with stoneware, plastic plates will require a pre-wash. There is a small platform for silverware, but I chose to add a steel basket I had laying around to hold my daily silverware. Fun to watch it wash the dishes. Plan out your spot and drainage and you will be good. With all the above considered, I like it.
